properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Temperatures will drop near the freezing mark overnight Monday to Tuesday. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-03T02:12:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-02T10:13:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1970688120.2019
Area: La Sarre area, Amos area, Lebel-sur-Quévillon area, Senneterre area, Rouyn area, Malartic area, Val d'Or - Louvicourt area, Ville-Marie area, Témiscaming area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Several severe thunderstorms continue to track eastward across south central SK this morning. These storms are expected to weaken later this morning. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-02T17:59:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-02T13:44:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3977580590.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:24 a.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A storm currently just northeast of Gravelbourg is tracking to the southeast at 30 km/h. Quarter sized hail and wind gusts to 90 km/h are possible with this storm. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-09-02T15:59:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-02T13:25:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0915699171.2019
Area: R.M. of Lake Johnson including Mossbank and Ardill, R.M. of Terrell including Spring Valley and Cardross, R.M. of Elmsthorpe including Avonlea and Truax
properties.Author: Environment Canada

Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms that developed over Alberta yesterday moved into western Saskatchewan overnight. These thunderstorms are expected to persist into the early morning hours. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-02T16:59:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-02T10:27:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1470764697.2019

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall continues early this morning. Scattered moderate to heavy showers, possibly with thunderstorms, are expected to continue this morning. Total rainfall amounts of 20 to 40 mm are expected, with locally higher amounts possible over areas near the St. Lawrence River. Showers are expected to move east of the area late this morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-02T16:14:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-02T09:37:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0941733417.2019
Area: Kingston - Odessa - Frontenac Islands, Napanee - Consecon, Picton - Sandbanks Park, Merrickville-Wolford - Kemptville, Westport - Charleston Lake, Brockville - Prescott, Gananoque - Mallorytown, Winchester - Newington, Morrisburg - Long Sault
